summary: This document is an email chain from June 2020 discussing a Virgin Islands Daily News article about an agreement to revise the Jeffrey Epstein victim compensation fund. The emails show internal confusion and inquiry about the FBI's role in the settlement and the fund's provisions. The forwarded article details Attorney General Denise George's statement that an agreement in principle was reached, including reforms to make the fund more victim-oriented.

events.title: Estate Proposes Victim Compensation Fund
events.description: Epstein's estate proposes a victim compensation fund as a way for victims to receive compensation without going to court.

keyFacts: Virgin Islands AG Denise George announced an agreement in principle to revise the Epstein victim compensation fund, including reforms to make it more victim-oriented.

Key reforms included involvement of a victim advocate/child sexual abuse expert, dedicated funding for victims to opt-out, protections for victim information, and access to FBI Victim Services and Child USA counseling.
The AG had previously filed a civil CICO action against the estate and placed liens on the over $600 million estate, restricting victim payouts.
The estate's initial proposal required victims to sign broad releases protecting other abusers, which the AG opposed and was reportedly removed in the new agreement.
An internal email chain shows confusion among recipients about the FBI's role in the victim services component of the settlement.
